name: Neapolitan Pizza Dough
instructions: Optional: Mix only the flour and water together and let rest for 20–30 minutes (autolyse). This helps gluten development and dough extensibility.
Dissolve salt into the water, then add the yeast to the flour.
Combine wet and dry ingredients. Mix until a rough dough forms.
Knead for 10–12 minutes by hand (or ~8 minutes in a stand mixer) until smooth and elastic.
Place dough in a covered container at room temperature for 6 hours (bulk fermentation).
After bulk fermentation, divide the dough into two 270g balls.
Place dough balls into lightly floured or oiled containers and cover.
Let the dough balls rest for 4–5 hours at room temperature before baking.
Preheat your Ooni Koda 16 for at least 30 minutes at its highest setting (450–480°C).
Stretch each dough ball gently, top as desired, and bake for 60–90 seconds until charred and bubbly.

storage_tips.room_temp: Use within 12 hours. Dough balls can be held for up to 6 hours after shaping.
storage_tips.refrigeration: For longer fermentation (18–24h), reduce yeast to 0.15% (0.25g) and refrigerate dough after kneading. Bring to room temp 3 hours before baking.
storage_tips.freezing_dough: Freeze dough balls after shaping. Defrost overnight in fridge, then bring to room temp for 3 hours before use.
